family.name: Tsunami2 Steam OEM Genesis
family.comment: These are the - OEM - version Tsunami2 Steam decoders

variable.tooltip:
Up to 127, this sets the speed step above which the intensity of BEMF control will be reduced
to zero. Values over 127 cause the BEMF to decrease as a percentage (up to 50%).
variable.label: BEMF Cutout (0-127 or 128-255)

variable.tooltip:
Sets the time period that is allowed to elapse between receipts of a valid packet
addressed to the decoder before a throttle shutdown occurs. Enter zero to disable.
variable.label: Packet Time Out Value (0-255)

variable.tooltip:
Defines the type of power source the decoder should
switch to whenever a DCC signal is not present.
(Tip: Alternate Power Source must be enabled)
variable.label: Power Source Conversion Type

variable.tooltip:
Enter the Lock ID Code to unlock access to the decoder CVs.
(Tip: Establish the unlock code with CV Lock ID Code)
variable.label: CV Unlock Register (0-7)

variable.tooltip: Sets the unlock code that must be entered into the CV Unlock Register in order to access the decoder CVs
variable.label: CV Lock ID Code (0-7)

variable.tooltip: Select a manufacturers speed curve, or use a curve you define yourself
variable.label: Speed Table Selection

variable.tooltip: Enable locking of CVs when decoder is used in a multi-decoder installation
variable.label: CV Lock Enable

variable.tooltip: Determines the effect generated from the headlight
variable.label: Headlight F0(f) Effect Selection

variable.tooltip: Alters the timing of the effect so that it's 180 degrees out of phase with the other effects
variable.label: Headlight F0(f) Phase Selection

variable.tooltip: Causes the lighting effect to become active only when the horn has been sounded
variable.label: Headlight F0(f) Grade Crossing Logic

variable.tooltip: Provides special compensation for lighting effect contrast when using LEDs
variable.label: Headlight F0(f) Light Type

variable.tooltip: Determines the effect generated from the backup light
variable.label: Backup Light F0(r) Effect Selection

variable.tooltip: Alters the timing of the effect so that it's 180 degrees out of phase with the other effects
variable.label: Backup Light F0(r) Phase Selection

variable.item: Backup Light F0(r) Grade Crossing Logic
variable.tooltip: Causes the lighting effect to become active only when the horn has been sounded
variable.label: Backup Light F0(r) Grade Crossing Logic

variable.tooltip: Provides special compensation for lighting effect contrast when using LEDs
variable.label: Backup Light F0(r) Light Type

variable.tooltip: Determines the effect generated from the FX3 light output
variable.label: FX3 Effect Selection

variable.tooltip: Alters the timing of the effect so that it's 180 degrees out of phase with the other effects
variable.label: FX3 Phase Selection

variable.tooltip: Causes the lighting effect to become active only when the horn has been sounded
variable.label: FX3 Grade Crossing Logic

variable.tooltip: Provides special compensation for lighting effect contrast when using LEDs
variable.label: FX3 Light Type

variable.tooltip: Determines the effect generated from the FX4 light output
variable.label: FX4 Effect Selection

variable.tooltip: Alters the timing of the effect so that it's 180 degrees out of phase with the other effects
variable.label: FX4 Phase Selection

variable.tooltip: Causes the lighting effect to become active only when the horn has been sounded
variable.label: FX4 Grade Crossing Logic

variable.tooltip: Provides special compensation for lighting effect contrast when using LEDs
variable.label: FX4 Light Type

variable.tooltip: Determines the second effect associated with the FX5 light output
variable.label: FX5 Effect Selection

variable.tooltip: Alters the timing of the effect so that it's 180 degrees out of phase with the other effects
variable.label: FX5 Phase Selection

variable.tooltip: Causes the lighting effect to become active only when the horn has been sounded
variable.label: FX5 Grade Crossing Logic

variable.tooltip: Provides special compensation for lighting effect contrast when using LEDs
variable.label: FX5 Light Type

variable.tooltip: Determines the second effect associated with the FX6 light output
variable.label: FX6 Effect Selection

variable.tooltip: Alters the timing of the effect so that it's 180 degrees out of phase with the other effects
variable.label: FX6 Phase Selection

variable.tooltip: Causes the lighting effect to become active only when the horn has been sounded
variable.label: FX6 Grade Crossing Logic

variable.tooltip: Provides special compensation for lighting effect contrast when using LEDs
variable.label: FX6 Light Type

Check to enable F0(f) function output in Forward direction
variable.label: Headlight F0(f) Forward Directional Control

variable.label: Backup Light F0(r) Forward Directional Control

variable.label: FX3 Forward Directional Control

variable.label: Headlight F0(f) Reverse Directional Control

variable.item: Backup Light F0(r) Reverse Directional Control
variable.tooltip: Check to enable F0(r) function output in Reverse direction
variable.label: Backup Light F0(r) Reverse Directional Control

variable.tooltip: Check to enable FX3 function output in Reverse direction
variable.label: FX3 Reverse Directional Control

variable.tooltip: Check to enable FX4 function output in Reverse direction

variable.tooltip: Check to enable FX5 function output in Reverse direction

variable.tooltip: Check to enable FX6 function output in Reverse direction

variable.tooltip: Check to enable FX7 function output in Reverse direction
Check to enable FX8 function output in Reverse direction
Sets the overall flash rate of the Hyperlight effects, 0 is fast, 15 is slow
variable.label: Hyperlight Flash Rate (0-15)

variable.tooltip: Sets the time (in seconds) an effect will stay on after the horn button is released
variable.label: Grade Crossing Hold Time (0-15)

variable.tooltip: Adjust the brightness level of any output set to the on/off brightness 1 effect
variable.label: Brightness 1 Level (0-255)

variable.tooltip: Adjust the brightness level of any output set to the on/off brightness 2 effect
variable.label: Brightness 2 Level (0-255)

variable.tooltip: Adjust the brightness level of the on/off dimmable headlight effect
variable.label: Dimmer Level (0-255)

variable.tooltip: Adjust the brightness level of all lighting outputs
variable.label: Master Brightness

variable.tooltip: Enabling 3-cylinder exhaust will allow the decoder to produce six chuffs every wheel rotation
variable.label: 3-cylinder exhaust

variable.tooltip:
Control the variation or timing syncopation when articulated exhaust
is enabled to simulate slipping drive wheels or a double-header.
variable.label: Slip Rate Control

variable.tooltip: Alters the exhaust timing to sound like a simple articulated engine when Auto Exhaust is activated
variable.label: Articulated Exhaust Control
Quiet Mode Timeout Period
variable.tooltip:
When loco has stopped and all functions are turned off, sound effects will turn
off automatically after timeout period has elapsed. Set to zero to disable.

For Auto-Exhaust synchronization, the chuff rate will be generated in proportion to the
throttle setting. Higher values = higher chuff rates; use zero to disable exhaust sound.
variable.label: Engine Exhaust Control
Motor Recovery Speed (0-255)
variable.tooltip:
Adjust the motor response following a momentary power glitch
0 or 128 = Disabled
1-127 = Absolute Limiting (will return to this speed step)
129-255 = Proportional Limiting (a percentage of set speed)
Selects which Whistle to use

enumChoice.choice: Hancock Flat Top 3-Chime UP No.4014 Road Mix
Hancock Flat Top 3-Chime UP No.4014 Yard Mix

variable.label: Whistle Select

variable.tooltip: Choose an alternate Whistle or a short blast of the primary Whistle

enumChoice.choice: Hancock Flat Top 3-Chime UP No.4014 Road Mix
Hancock Flat Top 3-Chime UP No.4014 Yard Mix

variable.label: Auxiliary Whistle Select

variable.tooltip: Bell sound effect and ring-rate
variable.label: Bell Select
Grade-Crossing Bell Enable
variable.tooltip: The selected bell to ring during the crossing-timer countdown when Grade-Crossing Logic is activated
Select one of chuff sound effects
variable.label: Exhaust Select

variable.tooltip: Select the air compressor sound effects
variable.label: Air Compressor Select

variable.tooltip: Select one of four dynamo sound effects
variable.label: Dynamo Select
Coupler Select
variable.tooltip: Determine the coupler release sound effect activated by the coupler function
Determine the on/off polarity of the coupler release sound effect activated by the coupler function

enumChoice.choice: Coupler release activated when function is turned on
Coupler release activated when function is turned off

variable.label: Coupler Release Function Polarity

variable.tooltip: Sets the overall volume of all sound channels
variable.label: Master Volume Control

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the airhorn
variable.label: Whistle Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the bell
variable.label: Bell Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the prime mover
variable.label: Exhaust Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the air compressor
variable.label: Airpump Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the Dynamos
variable.label: Dynamo Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the radiator fans
variable.label: Blower Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the side rod clank
variable.label: Side Rod Clank Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the cylinder cocks
variable.label: Cylinder Cocks Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the couplers coupling
variable.label: Coupler Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the brakes squealing
variable.label: Independent Brake Apply Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the brakes releasing
variable.label: Independent Brake Release Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the Snifter Valve
variable.label: Snifter Valve Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the air reservoir poppet valve releasing
variable.label: Johnson Bar/Power Reverser Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the Snifter Valve
variable.label: Safety Valve Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the couplers coupling
variable.label: Blowdown Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the couplers coupling
variable.label: Water Stop Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the couplers coupling
variable.label: Injector Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the emergency brake application
variable.label: E-Brake App Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the glad hand release
variable.label: Glad Hand Release Volume
All Aboard!/Coach Doors Volume
variable.tooltip: Not included in Econami software releases prior to version 1.3
Sets the volume of the couplers coupling
variable.label: Valve Packing Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the couplers coupling
variable.label: Firing Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the couplers coupling
variable.label: Oil Can/Grease Gun Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the couplers coupling
variable.label: Ash Dump Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the percentage of the whistle signal level to mix into the reverb input
variable.label: Whistle Reverb Level

variable.tooltip: Sets the percentage of the locomotive exhaust signal level to mix into the reverb input
variable.label: Exhaust Reverb Level

variable.tooltip: Sets the percentage of the air pump signal level to mix into the reverb input
variable.label: Air Pump Reverb Level
Auto-Bell On Set Point
variable.tooltip: Specifies the throttle speed step where the automatic bell will first turn on

variable.label: Auto-Bell On Time
variable.tooltip: Set the duration in seconds that elapses from the time the bell sound effect is automatically turned on to the time it is turned off
Not included in Econami software releases prior to version 1.3
variable.label: Max Coach Door Count

variable.tooltip: Specifies the negative rate of throttle change needed to activate the automatic brake squeal
variable.label: Brake Squeal Sensitivity
Automatic Bell Enable (Analog Mode)
variable.tooltip: Enables the Automatic Bell in Analog Mode
Enables the Automatic Brake Squeal in Analog Mode
variable.label: Automatic Brake Squeal Enable (Analog Mode)

variable.item: Automatic Grade Crossing Whistle Enable (Analog Mode)
variable.tooltip: Enables the Automatic Cylinder Cocks in Analog Mode
variable.label: Automatic Cylinder Cocks Enable (Analog Mode)
Automatic Bell Enable
variable.tooltip: Enables the Automatic Bell in Digital Mode
Enables the Automatic Brake Squeal in Digital Mode
variable.label: Automatic Brake Squeal Enable

variable.tooltip: Enables the Automatic Cylinder Cocks in Digital Mode
variable.label: Automatic Cylinder Cocks Enable

variable.tooltip: Duration that elapses from the time the engine is started and the auto-cylinder cocks sound effect is automatically turned on to the time it is automatically turned off.
variable.label: Cylinder Cocks On Time

variable.item: Probability Fireman Uses His Grease Gun
variable.label: Oil Can and Grease Gun Event Probability

variable.item: Probability Fireman Uses His Oil Can
variable.label: Cab Chatter Event Probability

variable.tooltip: Specifies a gain factor for the proportional part of the PID motor control equation
variable.label: Motor Kp Coefficient (0-255)

variable.tooltip: Specifies a gain factor for the integral part of the PID motor control equation
variable.label: Motor Ki Coefficient (0-255)

variable.tooltip: Specifies the gain value that is applied to the PID motor equation at low speeds to compensate for irregularities that occur during low-speed operation
variable.label: Low-Speed Compensation (0-255)

variable.tooltip: Specifies the percentage of back-EMF error (n/255) that is fed back from the control loop
variable.label: BEMF Feedback Intensity (0-255)

variable.tooltip: Specifies the time period in mS (milliseconds) between measurements
variable.label: Motor Control BEMF Sample Period (0-31)

variable.tooltip: Specifies a gain factor for the derivative part of the PID motor control equation
variable.label: Motor Control Sample Aperture Time (0-15)

variable.tooltip: Sets the back-EMF reference voltage by 0.1 volt increments, A value of 0 indicates that track voltage is used
variable.label: BEMF Reference Voltage (0-255)

variable.tooltip:
Determines the speed step at which voltage is first applied to the motor output to put the locomotive into motion.
Not included in Econami software releases prior to version 1.3
variable.label: Motor Speed Step Deadband (0-127)

variable.tooltip: Enable back-EMF motor control
variable.label: Back-EMF Enable

variable.tooltip: Direction commands will bring the motor to a full stop for a duration of 500ms before the decoder changes locomotive direction
variable.label: Auto-Stop Enable

variable.tooltip:
Determines the starting voltage level applied to the motor in analog mode;
The motor start voltage is calculated as a fraction of the available supply voltage.
Starting Voltage = (CV 218 10) + 6V
variable.label: Analog Mode Motor Start Voltage (0-255)

variable.tooltip: track voltage in analog mode at which the exhaust chuff sound begins
variable.label: Analog Mode Engine Start Voltage (0-255)

variable.tooltip:
determines the fixed distance over which the locomotive will decelerate to a stop after setting the throttle to zero
Entering a value of 0 will disable the constant brake distance feature
variable.label: Constant Brake Distance (0-255)

variable.tooltip: adjust the cutoff frequency of the decoders high-pass output filter 1=20Hz, 255=1kHz, 0=disabled
variable.label: High-Pass Filter Cutoff Frequency

variable.tooltip: Selects one of six equalizer presets or selects a user adjustable profile
variable.label: Equalizer Control

variable.tooltip: 0 = -12dB (Cut) : 128 = 0dB (Flat) : 255 = +12dB (Boost)
variable.label: 62 Hz Cut/Boost

variable.tooltip: 0 = -12dB (Cut) : 128 = 0dB (Flat) : 255 = +12dB (Boost)
variable.label: 125 Hz Cut/Boost

variable.tooltip: 0 = -12dB (Cut) : 128 = 0dB (Flat) : 255 = +12dB (Boost)
variable.label: 250 Hz Cut/Boost

variable.tooltip: 0 = -12dB (Cut) : 128 = 0dB (Flat) : 255 = +12dB (Boost)
variable.label: 500 Hz Cut/Boost

variable.tooltip: 0 = -12dB (Cut) : 128 = 0dB (Flat) : 255 = +12dB (Boost)
variable.label: 1K Hz Cut/Boost

variable.tooltip: 0 = -12dB (Cut) : 128 = 0dB (Flat) : 255 = +12dB (Boost)
variable.label: 2K Hz Cut/Boost

variable.tooltip: 0 = -12dB (Cut) : 128 = 0dB (Flat) : 255 = +12dB (Boost)
variable.label: 4K Hz Cut/Boost

variable.tooltip: Selects one of the reverb presets or selects a user adjustable profile
variable.label: Reverb Control

variable.tooltip: Specifies a percentage of the reverb output that is mixed back into the original audio signal (255=100%).
variable.label: Reverb Output Level

variable.tooltip: Specifies the total reverb delay time from 0 to 255 ms
variable.label: Reverb Delay

variable.tooltip: Specifies a percentage of the reverb output that is mixed back into the delay line (255=100%).
variable.label: Reverb Gain

Sets the status of automatic effects when moving in forward direction in analog power mode
Sets the status of automatic effects when moving in reverse direction in analog power mode
Sets the status of automatic effects when stopped in forward direction in analog power mode
Sets the status of automatic effects when stopped in reverse direction in analog power mode
Sets the status of automatic effects when moving in forward direction
Sets the status of automatic effects when moving in reverse direction
Sets the status of automatic effects when stopped in forward direction
Sets the status of automatic effects when stopped in reverse direction

Sets the status of automatic effects when in emergency stop.
Emergency Stop (ESTP) effects defined on Function Map
Most of the time this will be a value of 1 for SoundTraxx, but if you purchased the decoder installed in a model, the value will be different.

variable.tooltip: determines the minimum load required by the motor to move the model
variable.label: DDE Load Offset

variable.tooltip: determines the load required to increase the speed of the motor
variable.label: DDE Load Slope

variable.item: Side Rod Clank Low Volume Limit
variable.tooltip:
Sets the maximum attenuation level of the side rod clanking sound when
the locomotive is under heavy load. (higher no. = greater attenuation)
variable.label: Side Rod Clank Low Volume Limit

variable.item: Side Rod Clank High Volume Limit
variable.tooltip:
Sets the maximum volume level of the side rod clanking sound when
the locomotive is under light load. (higher no. = greater volume)
variable.label: Side Rod Clank High Volume Limit

variable.tooltip:
Sets the maximum attenuation level of the exhaust sound when the
locomotive is under light load. (higher no. = greater attenuation)
variable.label: Exhaust Low Volume Limit

variable.tooltip:
Sets the maximum volume level of the exhaust sound when the
locomotive is under heavy load. (higher no. = greater volume)
variable.label: Exhaust High Volume Limit

variable.tooltip:
Determines the amount of time needed before the DDE processor will begin reshaping
the audio signal once the motor or throttle input signal has begun to change.
variable.label: Attack Time Constant

variable.tooltip:
Determines the amount of time needed before the DDE processor will stop reshaping
the audio signal after the motor or throttle input signal has returned to normal.
variable.label: Release Time Constant

variable.tooltip:
Specifies the DDE sensitivity to the difference between the throttle
setting and the actual locomotive speed. Set to zero to disable.
variable.label: Throttle Sensitivity

variable.tooltip: <html>to adjust the correlation between the throttle setting and motor load sensinglt;br> sets how much the load signal is affected by the model accelerating/decelerating</html>
variable.label: Load Sensitivity

variable.tooltip: Scale Speed (ft/s) = (Speed Step CV 3.258) 100
variable.label: Clickety-Clack Sound Scalar

factReset.label: Reset all CVs to factory defaults
